intro: Sida jaliscensis, commonly known as Mexican mallow, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems, heart-shaped leaves, and showy pink to purple flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Sida jaliscensis is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
